info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued October 4 at 2:10PM AKDT until October 9 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Water levels 2 to 4 feet above the normal high tide line.
* WHERE...Bering Strait Coast and Southern Seward Peninsula Coast.
* WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 4 AM AKDT Sunday. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Tuesday morning through late Wednesday night.
* IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Localized beach erosion may occur.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect water levels to increase 2 to 4 feet above the normal high tide line tonight. Impacts shouldn't be too out of the ordinary, but minor erosion and wave run up is possible.
info.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
Precautions should be taken to protect property.

parameter.value: HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT SUNDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT

area.areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast
